description: From New Latin japonica, the species name.

definitionGroups.group: Any of several plants originally native to Japan.

entries.meaning: A species of camellia, Camellia japonica.
examples: To-day we have naming of parts. JaponicaGlistens like coral in all of the neighboring gardens,And to-day we have naming of parts.

entries.meaning: A subspecies of the rice Oryza sativa.
